Process math¶

Description

Graph¶

class Project.package_table.multiplication_table.process_math.Graph.Graph(table_number, modulo_number)¶
<<<<<<< HEAD

This class is for ….

=======

Graph class is used to contain the related specifications to the modular multiplication and create the associated undirected graph in the console

Parameters

  • N (float) – corresponds to the multiplication table assigned by the user. This number is rounded to \(10^{-2}\).

  • mod (int) – corresponds to the modulo number entered by the user.

  • M (numpy) – Symmetric adjacency matrix used to represent the graph. This dimension of this matrix is (mod*100, mod*100) whose non-diagonal element \(m_{ij}\) corresponds to an edge between vertex i and vertex j.

>>>>>>> main
Project.package_table.multiplication_table.process_math.Graph.Graph.__init__(self, table_number, modulo_number)¶

Constructor method. This method instantiates an empty graph.

Project.package_table.multiplication_table.process_math.Graph.Graph.print_matrix(self)¶

Displays the adjacency matrix

Project.package_table.multiplication_table.process_math.Graph.Graph.add_edge(self, i, j)¶

Create one edge between vertices i and j

Parameters

  • i (int) – vertex i

  • j (int) – vertex j

Project.package_table.multiplication_table.process_math.Graph.Graph.create_matrix(self)¶

Fill the adjacency matrix from the results of the modular multiplication

Project.package_table.multiplication_table.process_math.Graph.Graph.modulo_result(self, i)¶

Returns the result of the modular multiplication. For example, if N=2, i=7 and mod=10, this function return 2*7 mod 10 = 4

Parameters

i (int) – vertex i

Returns

Returns the result of the modular multiplication

Return type

float

Project.package_table.multiplication_table.process_math.Graph.Graph.print_graph(self)¶

Displays in a textual format all the vertices, each one of them is accompanied by all the edges incident to it
